InComment: I’d never been particularly studious back home, but with long months of vacations stretching before me, I figured some light reading would do me some good. It was just my luck, then, that the library was closed. On the door hung a small sign, with a handwritten “Closed, be right back!” Maybe I should’ve paid a little more attention when Shiro was explaining the schedules. Figuring I could just lounge around, in case it opened today, I explored the plaza. It was small and old but with that undeniable charm of a place well loved. A bit of a ways off, a *huge* tree stood tall and proud.

Dialogs.Text: I can's stop admiring its size. Its beautiful branches created a sort of canopy over the ground, shading it from the sun. As my eyes followed their shape, I noticed I’d almost stepped over a boy. Despite the fact that I was almost on top of him, the boy took no notice, nose buried in the pages of a book. His eyes moved quickly from side to side, completely enraptured.

Dialogs.Tought: Why, oh why, did I say that? Because I had no self control or self preservation, instead of backing up like a normal human being, I escalated the situation.  Grinning  with the particular brand of madness that comes from public humiliation, I pat the boy’s shoulder. What was I? His uncle?

The boy, rather reasonably, startled at the sound of my voice, sending the book flying. Now, I was no mind-reader... but the boy looked rather upset. Huffing in annoyance, he reached out for his fallen book.
God, what was I doing?! I removed my hand immediately and moved to brush the dirt from his book.
Dialogs.Text: “I am so sorry, I’ve got no idea what came over me.”

Dialogs.Tought: The boy swat my hand away with a resigned sigh, eyebrows pinched in annoyance.
Dialogs.Text: “Yeah, it’s fine.. .Can I just,” he gestured towards his book, “go back to reading? I’m kind of busy at the moment.”
“Of course! Lemme just...get out of your way then…”
Dialogs.Tought: I stood up, trying my best not to run away from the scene, stiff smile on my face. As soon as I was out of sight, I groaned.  That had been *beyond* humiliating!

Rocking on my heels for a bit, I tried to catch his eye, but the boy was completely enraptured. Feeling rather shy, I coughed to get his attention. I pretended to cough to catch his attention and I greeted him politely.
The boy looked up at me, big brown eyes widening in surprise. After a couple of blinks, he curled up, book against his chest and cheeks red. How cute!
Dialogs.Text: “Ah… h-hello. I didn’t notice you there.” He stole another glance. “Sorry.”
“That’s okay! Looks like you were really into your book.”
